instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R: What is PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R? Power rail on 820-2850 logic board for the GPU framebuffer, that is often underpowered and intermittent because of a dying C9560 capacitor that must be replaced on this model to avoid black screen & kernel panics..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message:
No history except that I see some caps for <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> were touched with solder. Maybe even replaced. Owner said it doesn't produce any image on screen.

Laptop starts, fans spin, I "think" (went quickly through voltage rail check), that voltages are present. Tried with external monitor, no luck. 

Any point what to check next? Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message: Try a new BIOS. Keep old one in case that is the issue. If no change, probably going to be a sucky one possibly no fix

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message: Yeah could be anything. Sounds like a bad CPU to me

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message:
Do you get L7630 voltage?
Also check L7720/60 and Power FETs on page 72.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> steady high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message:
Did you try one RAM module at a time, different DDR3 speed?
If someone changed caps on CPU area using hot air, overheating CPU, this board could be trash now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message:
No Title

Without RAM, there are no beeps (speaker is connected)

With faster RAM and one slot at a time, no luck.

*These caps were worked on (see pic)

**Tiny cap bottom left is fine, but I have aligned it after.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R</SIGNAL> should be 1.8V according to schematics. I have 1.33V. Could that be a problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message: Check on the schematic what <SIGNAL>FBVDD_ALTVO</SIGNAL> means...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message:
Got it. It's in 0 state. 

Alright, so any more ideas what could be wrong with the board? Are there any data lines that could be stopping Macbook from booting, just like with an iPhone?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message: As you've found signs of previous hot air attempts on CPU area, it could be dead now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> measures around 40 Ohms. Nothing gets too hot. I know there's tons of balls under CPU and PCH, but is there a way to check something that could point in some way/tell something about CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, pendrive doesn't flash, no brain despite vcore present
threads.message:
40 ohms is correct value.
Doesn't mean CPU should be good...
